page.title: 19The Clayhole
page.content: The Clayhole is a piece of wetland to be found between the village of Choppington and the Industrial Estate at Barrington. It was once the place where the clay was quarried for the nearby brickworks, hence the name "Clayhole". Nowadays it abounds with natural vegetation and a great variety of wild grasses and flowers are to be seen here. Pond-life of all kinds can be found in the form of frogs, newts, sticklebacks and the like. The children of the locality play various games at the Clayhole, making camps and playing hide and seek. At present the local council seem to be working on a land reclamation scheme in this area, so what has been a veritable paradise for generations of local children may soon be a thing of the past.
